src/queue.c

00001 /*
00002  *  \file queue.c
00003  *  \author Luciano Zemin, Nicolás Magni, Nicolás Purita
00004  *
00005  *  \brief      Make a circular buffer queue. The first time that the keyboard want to enqueue, this
00006  *              buffer start to save in position 1 and then continue as normally. If the pointer where it
00007  *              is adding is equal to the size of the queue start in the beginning of the buffer but at this
00008  *              time it will enqueue to the position 0.
00009  */
00010 
00011 #include "queue.h"
00012 
00013 /*
00014  * Function Defines
00015  */
00016 extern Keycode *keyboardBuffer;
00017 
00018 static int curr = 0, tail = 0;
00019 
00020 
00021 int charEnque ( Keycode elem )
00022 {
00023         if ( curr == KEYBOARD_BUFFER_SIZE - 1)
00024         {
00025                 if( tail != 0 )
00026                 {
00027                         keyboardBuffer[curr] = elem;
00028                         curr = 0;
00029                 }else
00030                         --curr; 
00031         }
00032         else
00033         {
00034                 if( curr+1 == tail )
00035                         --curr;
00036                 else
00037                         keyboardBuffer[curr++] = elem;
00038         }
00039         return TRUE;
00040 
00041 }
00042 
00043 Keycode charDeque ( void )
00044 {
00045          if( tail == KEYBOARD_BUFFER_SIZE )
00046                 tail = 0;
00047          if( tail == curr )
00048                  return '\0';
00049 
00050          return keyboardBuffer[tail++];
00051 }
00052 
00053 
00054 int kbBufferIsEmpty( void )
00055 {
00056         return curr == tail;
00057 }
